alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hillsborough; Pinellas (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 11 at 9:12PM EDT until October 12 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 PM EDT THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM EDT THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 5 PM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 5 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Pinellas and Coastal Hillsborough Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 2 AM to 8 PM EDT Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 2 AM EDT Thursday through Thursday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM to 5 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
